intro: Centaurium pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered centaury, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Centaurium pauciflorum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
